item.title: 腐败丑闻加重了哥伦比亚财政部长的压力
item.description: 哥伦比亚财政部长因涉嫌腐败丑闻而受到新的指控，就在政府努力应对日益加深的财政危机之际，这给总统古斯塔沃-佩特罗（Gustavo Petro）带来了更多的麻烦。【原文：Colombia’s finance chief has been hit with fresh accusations in an alleged corruption scandal, adding to complications for President Gustavo Petro just as the government tries to navigate a deepening fiscal crisis.】

item.title: 摩根大通全球投资银行部主席退休，加入埃森哲董事会
item.description: 摩根大通银行投资银行部全球主席珍妮弗-纳森（Jennifer Nason）在华尔街最大的贷款机构工作了近四十年后，即将从摩根大通银行退休。【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co.’s global chair of investment banking, Jennifer Nason, is set to retire from the bank after nearly four decades at Wall Street’s largest lender.】

item.title: 简街称前交易员嘲笑 "愚蠢 "的千禧年策略
item.description: 简街集团称，一名前交易员窃取了千禧年管理公司价值数十亿美元的印度期权秘密策略，该交易员曾嘲笑新雇主的策略是 "愚蠢的"。【原文：Jane Street Group said a former trader whom it claims stole secret billion-dollar India options strategies for Millennium Management previously ridiculed his new employer’s own strategies as “dumb.”】

item.title: 加拿大皇家银行晋升 Sian Hurrell 为欧洲资本市场部主管
item.description: 加拿大皇家银行提拔 Sian Hurrell 为欧洲资本市场业务主管。【原文：Royal Bank of Canada has promoted Sian Hurrell to lead its capital markets business in Europe.】

item.title: 芝加哥计划在预算僵局中再融资 8.06 亿美元债券
item.description: 芝加哥计划本周出售约 8.06 亿美元的市政债券，作为再融资的一部分，布兰登-约翰逊市长正努力在年底前弥补近 10 亿美元的预算缺口。【原文：Chicago is planning to sell about $806 million in municipal bonds this week as part of a refinancing as Mayor Brandon Johnson races to close a budget gap of nearly $1 billion by year end.】

item.title: Northvolt 任命 Markus Dangelmaier 为总厂首席执行官
item.description: Northvolt AB 已任命 Markus Dangelmaier 为 Northvolt Ett AB 的首席执行官，这是该公司唯一一家生产电池芯的工厂。【原文：Northvolt AB has named Markus Dangelmaier chief executive officer of Northvolt Ett AB, its only factory that’s producing battery cells.】

item.title: 首席执行官离职后，Stellantis 将启用美国老板和前首席财务官担任职务
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，Stellantis NV 将提名包括北美公司老板 Antonio Filosa 在内的高管加入一个委员会，接替下台的首席执行官卡洛斯-塔瓦雷斯（Carlos Tavares），该汽车制造商正努力填补领导层的空缺。【原文：Stellantis NV will nominate executives including North America boss Antonio Filosa to a committee taking over from ousted Chief Executive Officer Carlos Tavares, according to people familiar with the matter, as the automaker works to fill a leadership void.】

item.title: 简街通过 10 亿美元贷款交易重返债务市场
item.description: 简街集团有限责任公司（Jane Street Group LLC）在周一的交易热潮中推出了一笔 10 亿美元的杠杆贷款，从而重返杠杆债务市场。【原文：Jane Street Group LLC is back in the leveraged debt markets after launching a $1 billion leveraged loan on Monday amid a rush of deals.】

item.description:

item.title: 美联储主席博斯蒂克对 12 月利率决议保持 "开放 "态度
item.description: 亚特兰大联邦储备银行行长拉斐尔-博斯蒂克（Raphael Bostic）表示，他还没有决定本月是否需要降息，但仍认为官员们应在未来几个月继续降息。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta President Raphael Bostic said he’s undecided on whether an interest-rate cut is needed this month, but still believes officials should continue lowering rates over the coming months.】

item.title: Prime Capital 收购瑞典 RES 公司的绿色航空燃料项目
item.description: 德国资产管理公司 Prime Capital AG 收购了瑞典的一个合成航空燃料项目，这是在最近遭遇挫折后对该国绿色技术转型的一个推动。【原文：German asset manager Prime Capital AG bought a synthetic aviation fuel project in Sweden, in a boost for the nation’s green-tech transition after recent setbacks.】

item.title: 摩根大通交易员的计算结果显示：月底前标普 500 指数将接近 6,300 点
item.description: 摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：Even after the strongest rally since the early days of the dot-com boom, the S&P 500 Index still has room to push higher through the end of the year, according to JPMorgan Chase & Co.’s trading desk.】

item.title: 审计长称加拿大对科维德时代数十亿商业贷款的监管失误
item.description: 加拿大审计长表示，加拿大政府在 "科威德-19 "大流行期间向企业发放了 490 亿加元（约合 348 亿美元）贷款，却没有 "适当考虑资金的价值"。【原文：The Canadian government rolled out C$49 billion ($34.8 billion) in loans to businesses during the Covid-19 pandemic without “due regard for value for money,” the country’s auditor general said.】

item.title: 克里姆林宫终止对俄罗斯部门的控制后嘉士伯股价上涨
item.description: 俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔-普京（Vladimir Putin）签署法令结束政府对嘉士伯俄罗斯业务的控制后，嘉士伯公司股价上涨。【原文：Carlsberg A/S shares rose after Russian President Vladimir Putin signed a decree ending government control of the brewer’s Russian business.】

item.title: 惠誉下调奥克兰信用评级，加州城市努力弥补预算缺口
item.description: 惠誉评级公司（Fitch Ratings）将加利福尼亚州奥克兰市的信用评级下调了两级，理由是在政治领导层更迭的情况下，该市面临着填补预算缺口的挑战。【原文：Oakland, California, had its credit rating cut two levels by Fitch Ratings, which cited the challenge of plugging budget gaps amid a change in political leadership.】

item.title: 欧佩克（OPEC）原油产量上升，利比亚的复苏抵消了伊拉克的限制
item.description: 欧佩克（OPEC）原油产量连续第二个月增长，原因是利比亚继续从关闭其最大油田的政治纷争中恢复过来。【原文：OPEC’s crude production increased for a second month as Libya continued to recover from a political feud that had shuttered its biggest oil field.】

item.title: 美国将宣布向乌克兰提供价值 7.25 亿美元的新武器包
item.description: 据两位官员称，美国即将宣布从美国库存中为乌克兰提供的最新一揽子武器计划，该计划总额约为 7.25 亿美元，其中包括乔-拜登总统授权的第二批杀伤人员地雷。【原文：The US is poised to announce the latest arms package for Ukraine drawn from US inventories, this one totaling about $725 million and including the second shipment of antipersonnel mines that President Joe Biden has authorized, according to two officials.】

item.title: 安大略省医疗保健养老金任命 Annesley Wallace 为首席执行官
item.description: 安大略省医疗保健养老金计划任命安大略省市政雇员退休系统前高管 Annesley Wallace 为新总裁兼首席执行官。【原文：Healthcare of Ontario Pension Plan appointed Annesley Wallace, a former executive with Ontario Municipal Employees Retirement System, as its new president and chief executive officer.】

item.title: 安哥拉希望国营航空公司TAAG于2026年私有化
item.description: 安哥拉计划明年继续重组国有航空公司TAAG，然后在2026年启动该航空公司的私有化进程。【原文：Angola plans to continue restructuring state-owned airline TAAG next year before initiating the carrier’s privatization process in 2026.】

item.title: 格鲁吉亚总理在欧盟与抗议者发生冲突后排除了与反对派会谈的可能性
item.description: 格鲁吉亚总理排除了与反对派举行会谈的可能性。此前，格鲁吉亚首都连续四晚发生暴力冲突，致使拉里对美元的汇率跌至两年来的最低点。【原文：Georgia’s premier ruled out holding talks with the opposition after four nights of violent clashes in the capital helped propel the lari to a two-year low against the dollar.】

item.title: 突尼斯经济衰退，期待中央银行偿还债务
item.description: 在国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）的潜在救助陷入僵局后，突尼斯经济萎靡不振，突尼斯政府连续第二年寻求中央银行帮助偿还外债。【原文：Tunisia’s government is looking to the central bank to help repay its external debt for a second straight year, as the economy languishes after a potential International Monetary Fund bailout stalled.】

item.title: 声名狼藉的瑞士信贷债券助长了 Ken Leech 的欺诈指控
item.description: 去年，瑞士最高监管机构的一个惊人举动引发了整个债券市场的愤怒。至少对一位资深人士来说，这一举动变成了更糟糕的事情。【原文：A shock move by a top Swiss regulator last year sparked outrage across the bond market. For at least one veteran, it turned into something much worse.】

item.title: 稳定性风险缓解，奥地利将放宽抵押贷款限额
item.description: 奥地利金融市场稳定委员会将于明年取消对住房贷款的严格限制，认为房地产市场过热的危险已经过去。【原文：Austria’s Financial Market Stability Board will let strict limits on home loans expire next year, arguing that the danger of overheating in the property market has now passed.】

item.title: 萨利纳斯一天内将损失 40 亿美元，Elektra 暴跌 60
item.description: 在监管机构下令交易所恢复长期停牌后，Grupo Elektra 股价周一暴跌超过 60%，亿万富翁里卡多-萨利纳斯-普利戈（Ricardo Salinas Pliego）的身家因此缩水约 40 亿美元。【原文：Shares of Grupo Elektra tumbled more than 60% on Monday after regulators ordered the exchange to resume trading following a prolonged halt, wiping off some $4 billion from the fortune of billionaire Ricardo Salinas Pliego.】

item.title: 前万事达首席运营官为俄罗斯经营 "高级 "保加利亚间谍组织
item.description: 检察官在伦敦对三名被控为俄罗斯从事间谍活动的保加利亚人进行审判时说，在逃的前万通卡首席运营官扬-马萨莱克（Jan Marsalek）在一次国际间谍活动中发挥了关键作用。【原文：Jan Marsalek, the fugitive ex-Wirecard chief operating office, played a crucial role in an international espionage operation, prosecutors said at the London trial of three Bulgarians accused of spying for Russia.】

item.description:

item.title: 前往纽约市的新泽西运输公司和美铁列车服务暂停或延误
item.description: 周一早上，由于三州部分地区气温冰冻，进出纽约宾夕法尼亚车站的新泽西运输公司（New Jersey Transit）和美国铁路公司（Amtrak）列车出现长时间延误。【原文：New Jersey Transit and Amtrak trains coming into and out of New York Penn Station are experiencing lengthy delays Monday morning as freezing temperatures hit parts of the tristate area.】

item.title: 希腊告诉投资者不打算对银行征收额外税款
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，希腊并不打算对银行征收任何特别税。【原文：Greece isn’t planning to impose any extraordinary tax on its banks, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 订单增加，美国工厂活动萎缩幅度低于预期
item.description: 美国 11 月份制造业活动的萎缩幅度低于预期，因为一项衡量新订单的指标八个月来首次进入扩张区间，并表明企业信心正在逐步改善。【原文：US manufacturing activity shrank in November by less than forecast as a gauge of new orders moved into expansion territory for the first time in eight months and indicated business confidence is gradually improving.】

item.title: 英国希望在实现 2.5% 目标之前加强军工供应链
item.description: 在政府准备就何时增加国防开支做出更明确承诺的同时，英国将 "比试 "其国内供应链和军队如何抵御未来的冲击。【原文：The UK will “war game” how well its domestic supply chain and military can withstand future shocks, as the government prepares a clearer commitment on when it will increase defense spending.】
